page.title: 01Description,Lyminge/Stowting
page.content: Tha area consists of farmland, mainly used for grazing, and deciduous and coniferous forest. West Wood, which is a part of Lyminge Forest, is maintained by the Forestry Commission and provides pleasant forest walks and picnic areas. To the south east lies a small corner of the village of Lyminge. This section is mainly modern two and three bedroom bungalows. The village of Rhodes Minnis is composed of a small number of houses strung along the single main road. Also to be found along this road is the former manor of Sibton Park, now a private school for girls. To the west lies the village of Stowting with its church and two teacher primary school. The area is completely unspoilt and has changed very little over the years.
